item.title: Spying on keyboards : A toy model.
item.description: With meltdown and spectre, side-channel attacks have been all the rage recently. One class of side channel attacks that seem especially magical to me are acoustic side-channel attacks. This is where information about a system can be gleaned simply by recording the sounds that they emit. In this blog post I’d like to explore how one could infer what is being typed on a keyboard by recording the sounds that are created while typing.
